Theo Goetemann is the Founder of Basil Labs, a big data consumer intelligence startup that helps organizations quantify in store consumer experience (CX) to craft stronger brands and optimize location placement and offerings. Prior to Basil Labs, Theo has worked in the entrepreneurship, data journalism and open data fields. His work has been featured in CityLab, National Journal and the Network Science Initiative and often joins narrative inquiry with network science and natural language processing and explores the intersection of virtual communities and the physical world. Theo earned his Bachelor’s degree in Government from Georgetown University, graduating with Honors with Distinction; his thesis examined the rapid expansion of national open data initiatives globally. He was selected as a 2019 Fulbright Research Scholarship recipient and regularly speaks on entrepreneurship, data and tech.

Outside of work, Theo enjoys listening to and producing music. Some favorites for listening are Simon & Garfunkel, Josh Ritter, Feed Me, Lupe Fiasco, Nujabes, J Dilla, Robert Glasper, P.O.S, Phonte.
